content:
Weirdly, iD offers to upgrade generic "Rimi" into "Rimi Mini"
rimi...-mini-question-mark.png
Which I suppose is because there is no version without a qualifier... https://nsi.guide/index.html?t=brands&k=shop&v=supermarket&tt=rimi
Is that actually true in Latvia - are all Rimis one of the variants? I have never paid attention.

At least their site indicates that way: https://www.rimi.lv/veikali

Rimi - Veikali
Rimi

And signs have the qualifier:
image.png
Though I cannot find a proper sign on the entrance for "Super" type, and to be honest in doubt about it rn.
I suppose if we tag them all, it won't be an issue. But people may end up mistagging if they don't pay attention. Editors click "fix" a lot without reading anything.

markalex2209 said:

Though I cannot find a proper sign on the entrance for "Super" type, and to be honest in doubt about it rn.

Yeah, those exist for sure. The one I saw was literally the Super version and I wanted to upgrade tags first, but it changed to Mini, which is when I noticed this behaviour.
super-rimi-combo.png

HellMap said:

I suppose if we tag them all, it won't be an issue. But people may end up mistagging if they don't pay attention. Editors click "fix" a lot without reading anything.

Yes. I requested this change with intention to retag all of them eventually.

Before problem was that if you named shop Rimi Mini, iD would suggest to retag it as 

name=Rimi
branch=Mini

And this is incorrect use of branch.
But you'll have to believe me on word here, because I retagged all those with incorrect use of branch (in Latvia) as soon as NSI was updated.
Yeah, the old style was incorrect. I simply didn't event consider what happens when there is no un"branched" version and what iD would actually offer to do

markalex2209 said:

But you'll have to believe me on word here, because I retagged all those with incorrect use of branch (in Latvia) as soon as NSI was updated.

Yeah, no, I saw your edits and know how the branches were used before, so all great :tada:

HellMap said:

Yeah, the old style was incorrect. I simply didn't event consider what happens when there is no un"branched" version and what iD would actually offer to do

I believe behaviour is undefined. I've seen some shops suggested to tag to Mini, some - to Hyper with no apparent reason.
Yeah, probably just whatever match result Javascript iD order ends up being
